attributes.action: SCRAP THE BACKDATED RATE DEMANDS IN PORTS IN ENGLAND AND WALES
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We highlight the problems being caused by the Valuation Office Agency's (VOA) late revaluation and presentation of any information to Port Operators in England and Wales.

The problem is exacerbated by a change in the method of collecting rates on port estates, which was not announced until 2007 (Over 2 years after the date when the VOA should have carried-out the revaluations) and has resulted in operators being faced with massive rates demands, three years back-dated.

Operators see this as grossly unfair and are seeking support to appeal to the Government as the future of many smaller businesses is threatened and we believe the action of the VOA is contrary to Government policy of encouraging investment and jobs within the UK.

The solution to this crisis is for the backdating demand to be dropped and for a period of consultation before the next Business Rates Review in 2010, giving time for all other aspects to be addressed.

We hope you can assist by adding your name to this petition and thank you for your co-operation.

Graeme R Nimmo, FICS
General Manager
Institute of Chartered Shipbrokers
Federation Council.
